column3: Choisissez l'époque à laquelle vous débutez

column2: Emblem Kings covers several dates in Fire Emblem history.  Choose where in the timeline you want your game to start.

Lyn, the last survivor of the Lorca clan, has learned that she is the granddaughter of Marquess Hausen of Caelin. As she begins her journey towards Caelin, Hausen's younger brother Lundgren plots to keep her away from the throne... and hasten his own inheritance.

The continent of Elibe teeters on the brink of war. In Lycia, Marquess Elbert of Pherae vanishes among whispers of rebellion, while shadowy figures slip in and out of castles in Laus and Santaruz. In Bern, a succession crisis looms as the envious King Desmond schemes to keep his popular and talented son off the throne. A league of assassins can be connected to all these events, directed by a mysterious sorceror...

A thousand-year peace is shattered as King Zephiel of Bern begins to conquer the continent. He plans for the divided people of Sacae and Ilia to fall quickly, allowing Bern to turn its attention to the other major powers - the Kingdom of Etruria and the Lycian League. Can the wealth of Etruria or the champions of Lycia prevail against the secret weapons of Bern, or will King Zephiel succeed in his plan to "liberate" Elibe?

It is the dawn of the age of humanity. In Archanea, the dragon wars reach an end. The Divine Dragon tribe subdues the feral Earth Dragons before sealing their own powers away and entrusting the future to the humans they fought to protect. The first great human civilization, the Grann Republic of Jugdral, celebrates the 110th year since its founding. However, the republic is about to face a crisis that will change the continent forever. A young priest has returned from journeys overseas, preaching a strange new religion and wielding ominous magic...

The Holy War is over. Emperor Galle XVII lies dead and his brutal empire has been shattered by the Twelve Crusaders. With Jugdral at peace for the first time in fifteen years, the Crusaders part ways and found new nations to build a brighter future for the land.

The Kingdom of Grannvale declares war on the Kingdom of Isaach following an attack on Darna, a site sacred to both nations. With the bulk of Grannvale's army in the east, soldiers of Verdane sieze their opportunity to raid the country's western lands, capturing territory and noble prisoners. These events are just the overt moves of a grand scheme involving Grannvalean court intrigue and an ancient cult...

The fifteen years since the Grannvale Empire unitied the continent have seen the land shoved back into a darker age. The empire's rule grows more oppressive by the day and members of the Loptyrian Order practice their twisted rituals in the open. The hope of the people rests with Seliph Chalphy, Sigurd's son and member of the resistance army gathering in Isaach.

Bishop Galle was originally a priest of the Earthen religion. He believed the legends that drinking the blood of a legendary creature would bestow upon him power of unimaginable proportions, and travelled the world in search of such a beast. He found himself in Archanea during the dragon war, where he formed a blood pact with the Earth Dragon Loptyr. Galle inherited the dragon's power and malevolent will.
A young girl from the Lorca tribe. Stouthearted and kind.
Marquess Caelin's brother. Hungers to rule over Caelin.
The beloved and benevolent ruler of Pherae.
Marquess Pherae's young son. Just and honorable.
A man of average skill and intellect, with a envious and cruel streak.
The next heir to Pherae. The protagonist of this story.
The leader of the Lycian League and the Marquess of Ostia.
The mighty king of Bern. A talented and gifted genius.
The old king of Etruria, grief-stricken over the loss of his son and heir.
The leader of the Kutolah clan, one of the largest Sacaean nomad tribes.
The head of the Ilian Mercenary Knights.
The leader of the resistance movement against Etruria in the Western Isles.
The protector of Nabata. A mysterious air surrounds him.
An avaricious fiend who turns death into power.
A Ganelon bandit called the Beast for his savagery,
The gods fear his peerless swordplay.
The leader of the Ganelon Bandits.
The leader of the Twelve Crusaders.
Son of Duke Byron of Chalphy.
The charismatic and talented Duke of Velthomer. He schemes to take greater power within the kingdom and create a world free of prejudice where all peoples can live without fear of repression.
The old king of Grannvale. His age and declining health have caused him to entrust much of his responsibilities to his skilled and respected son Prince Kurth.

The former Crown Prince of Isaach, forced to take the crown after his father was executed during an attempt to broker peace with Grannvale. He believes the war cannot be won, but hopes his sister and son will survive to return Isaach to glory...
